intro: Cyphostemma ringoetii, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
